chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
All charges against Daniel C Lalonde in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel C Lalonde is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Cassandra Miller

3:12 PM Defendant Daniel C Lalonde not in court.  Attorney Daniel Gutierrez for attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Daniel C Lalonde. 

The State moves to dismiss as the Defendant is deceased.
No objection from the Defense.
The Court dismisses the case.

EXT code 3

10:02 AM Attorney Cassandra A Miller in court.   Defendant Daniel C Lalonde did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Miller is unsure where her client is today. 
State reports WCS non compliance report filed.
Court revokes and forfeits bail, issues capias.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 08-04-2022 received and filed.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:16 AM Defendant Daniel C Lalonde in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel C Lalonde appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense counsel requests another status date. Defendant must appear in person at next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 06-23-2022 received and filed.
Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 05/18/2022:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses A-C/Pistol Petes Bar/Officer H. (unless in an emergency fashion/or if they initiate contact) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:22 AM Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel C Lalonde in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Court amends the conditions of bond to include:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Court informs defendant to report to room C226 after court today to sign the amended bond.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
